comment: For MAED 1190 & 2390: Very Caring and goes above and beyond for every student. Willing to help after class and she's understanding if you need extra time with something if you have an excuse. Doesn't go ahead until all students understand. Class can be very difficult if you don't attend or pay attention the entire time. Ask Questions!!
I don't really hate her that much but if a professor says that no one has passed her class, drop it immediately. Don't take it as a challenge.

Dr. Edwards brings a wealth of teaching knowledge to the course. This class is better suited to an online format. There isn't any reason for students to drive so far to learn when face-to-face is not needed to achieve the same goals. Groups work collaboratively and several large projects throughout the course.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Edwards really cares about her students and will answer any questions you have. If you can PLEASE STAY AFTER CLASS!! She likes to see students taking initiative in their learning. She cares about the students that care about their work. She reuses homework questions on quizzes and quiz questions on tests so look over any work you get back.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I really enjoyed her class. Keep in mind, this is a math class for future teachers, so working with classmates and teaching each other works best. Will offer extra credit after an exam if grades weren't as expected. Most of her test questions come straight from her study guides/study suggestions. Stay after class for help, she is great one-on-one.

Covered a lot of material in this class and attendance was mandatory. Miss 2 classes and your grade drops a grade. Several textbooks were required to purchase, some more useful than others, and a significant focus on equity in the classroom. Group discussion and collaboration were a class norm. Big lesson plan project in the final weeks of class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: This class was a complete struggle. She never made since on anything. EX: she would give an answer to a problem and then change it and not tell us how or why she changed it. A lot of self teaching. Barely survived the class
This really should be an online class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Such a sweet lady but she is not a good teacher. She often makes mistakes and one of the students has to correct her before she notices. She gave 4 test. There were pratice test the class before the actually test. The pratice test were similar to the actual test. All hw is on ALEKS. She takes attendance every class and it counts for a grade.

Math is my strong suit and this class was confusing. All of class was dedicated to her trying to figure out how to solve a problem. She did not know the material at all. If a questioned was asked, she was rude. She ignores emails about helping your grade but will post on d2l. Responds only if you ask for help on a certain question.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Edwards is the kindest lady in the world. She is very dedicated to teaching and truly wants you to succeed. However she is very unorganized and gets off topic easily, this means she gets behind we had very few actual grades in this class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She is very bad at teaching concepts, and math is my strong subject. She teaches the wrong way first and then corrects herself after the student corrects her. I had a very hard time understanding things in this class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She's a nice lady, but if it were not for the fact that I took this class in High School, I probably would've gotten a C. Take only if you know precalculus well. If not, AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY

comment: Worst teacher I've ever taken.  Doesn't teach a lick of the material.  Hardly knows what she's teaching and often gets example questions wrong.  Terrible professor

Had her for MATH 1113. Her lectures were super easy. She tends to go over stuff more than once if her students don't understand. She sometimes gives extra credit during class. PLEASE DO THE HOMEWORK! It's worth more than the quizzes. But I recommend her!
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: DO NOT TAKE HER. Dr. Edwards clearly has no understanding of what she teaches. She often makes mistakes doing examples in class and is very confusing in her explanations. When asking her for help, she is often rude and condescending, and is almost impossible to reach outside of class.

Wish I never took this class. I feel totally unprepared for Calculus because she doesn't teach you formulas or how to solve. She teaches how to interpret. She wastes a lot of time at the beginning of the semester and then rushes through the rest of the material. I wouldn't recommend her to anyone.

She's a very confusing teacher; she'll go over material so much that it wouldn't make sense anymore. Her lectures are boring and she's not the most reasonable person. There were cases where she would give us home work, say that she wouldn't make it due anymore, then change her mind again at the last minute causing some of us to fail the assignment.

The class is all about concepts, and even though it was taken over the summer, she never moved on until there weren't any questions yet. Best teacher I've had for a math-related education course so far in my college career. Makes challenging concepts easy, and gives fair grades for reasonable assessments.

She's all right, but can get confusing. Her tests can be worded tricky and even if everyone gets a question wrong she will think it was because we were dumb. MAKE sure you keep count of your points because she will not keep up with them all of the time and EXTRA POINTS MATTER!! A quiz every week so don't plan to skip either!
This comments are way off. If you have the chance take her. She is the most understanding professor. Just answer the question from the rubrics and you'll do fine.

Edwards class is not absolutely necessary to go the class because she posts power points/notes online. Also gives practice test, study guide, and practice questions for exams. Although her class is boring, she is willing to help you anytime you ask. She offers the best way possible for you to pass the class such as dropping lowest quiz grade, ect.

Dr. Edwards always posts notes for class and study guides. She gives plenty of opportunity for bonus points and her questions on the test are right off of her quizzes. She is very kind and easy to contact. Make sure to check vista often though, because she may change the schedule sometimes. Do your homework since she will go over it in class.

Very poor teaching ability. She uses "you should remember how to do this from high school" as a crutch to avoid going over things. was always getting problems wrong on the board. if you need to see something done right to learn it this is not the teacher for you.

The class was horrible! She does not know what she is talking about. You have to teach yourself everything and you will learn where the math lab is very quickly! Drop her if it is not too late, your GPA will thank you.

Ms. Edwards is very approachable.  I'll admit, her class was hard but she was more than willing to meet students after class and work until they understood.  I would recommend taking her.  She's fair in grading and approachable with questions.  Very willing to help students.  Also, lots of opportunities for points other than test grades.

She does not know what she is doing.  If you take this class you will have to teach yourself the material, so plan on reading the text.  She changes the schedule often, and she will add tests extra test despite her syllabus.  Do not ask her to clarify anything.  She will just  confuse you as well as herself. Great example of how not to teach.

Like everyone else said, she didn't have a clue what she was doing most of the time in 1113. In 3316, she got angry with me because I didn't have to pay attention, study, or do homework to get an A on everything and I guess she decided she hated me. After the mess she created for me in the ECE dep't, I decided I hated it all anyway and went to Bio.
Very hard to learn anything from her if you're not good with math to begin with.  Lots of opportunities for grades and extra credit though.
Lots of opportunities for grades.  Teacher is confusing & makes lots of mistakes.  Not the worst math teacher, but certainly not the best.
she is very accessible by email
This lady is insane and makes errors constantly.  Her quizzes are easy, tests are okay, but you pretty much teach yourself.

Horrible teacher but a nice person.  She knows about as much as the students she is trying to teach!  Our class was mainly taught by a student because of all the professor's math errors; the student would catch them and finish the lesson.
This woman does not know how to teach. If you are taking her class DROP IT BEFORE IT's TOO LATE!!!

She was a pretty easy teacher yet a very poor one.  She didnt understand the information, so she taught solely from the book.  Many times she made mathematical errors and her students had to correct her.  I wouldn't reccommend her.  Take Dr. Burke instead
Ms. Edwards is quite possibly the nicest person on earth. Her lectures are easy to follow.

mrs edwards is a very good teacher. She gives about one quiz a week which are just over your homework,and only 4 tests throughout the semester. she then will let you drop one test and one quiz,also gives you homeworks which will help grade.take her class
